an5.161:1.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant should use these five ways to completely get rid of resentment when it has arisen toward anyone.
an5.161:1.3: You should develop love for an individual you resent.
an5.161:1.4: That’s how to get rid of resentment for that individual.
an5.161:1.5: You should develop compassion for an individual you resent. …
an5.161:1.7: You should develop equanimity for an individual you resent. …
an5.161:1.9: You should disregard an individual you resent, paying no attention to them. …
an5.161:1.11: You should focus on the ownership of deeds regarding that individual:
an5.161:1.12: ‘This venerable is the owner of their deeds and heir to their deeds. Deeds are their womb, their relative, and their refuge.
an5.161:1.13: They shall be the heir of whatever deeds they do, whether good or bad.’
an5.161:1.14: That’s how to get rid of resentment for that individual.
an5.161:1.15: A mendicant should use these five ways to completely get rid of resentment when it has arisen toward anyone.”
